channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pakistanis Rise Up Against Ruling Elite as Misery Multiplies
item.description: Unrest over a range of economic and security issues threatens to deepen the political turmoil that has plagued Pakistan for years.

item.title: Pakistanis Rise Up Against Ruling Elite as Misery Multiplies
item.description: Unrest over a range of economic and security issues threatens to deepen the political turmoil that has plagued Pakistan for years.

item.title: Wall Street wanted a September rate cut—instead it got a ‘baby step’ and stocks are hurting as a result
item.description: "I am skeptical that the key economic data over the next seven weeks are going to add to the FOMC’s confidence."

item.title: July Jobs Report: What to Know
item.description: Job gains are lately being driven by the government, health care and social assistance sectors, potentially masking broadly weaker hiring.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Hamas Leader Mourned in Qatar With Middle East on Edge
item.description: Mourners were gathering for the funeral of Ismail Haniyeh, the political leader of Hamas who was assassinated earlier this week. President Biden expressed deep concern about the situation in the region, and called on Israel to agree to a cease-fire in Gaza.

item.title: British Airways sees travel demand take off, but parent IAG kills bid for Air Europa after EU scrutiny
item.description: The airline has reintroduced its first dividend payment since the start of the Covid pandemic.

item.title: A Major Prisoner Exchange, and U.S. Says Venezuelan Opposition Won
item.description: Plus, Simone Biles takes gold — again.

item.title: Why Some Young People in China Pretend to Be Birds
item.description: Some young people in China pretend to be birds on social media as way of escaping hustle culture. We can explain.

item.title: It’s not just you: Simone Biles has destigmatized mental health leave for millions of women
item.description: In Tokyo, Biles showed she was brave enough to put herself first. In Paris, she proved she was able to come back stronger.

item.title: Museum of Jewish Heritage Is Using A.I. to Preserve Holocaust Survivors’ Stories
item.description: The Museum of Jewish Heritage is using artificial intelligence to create an installation where visitors can interact with people who directly experienced the Holocaust.

item.title: Winzar Kakiouea Is a One-Man Team From Nauru. His Olympics Might be Over in 10 Seconds.
item.description: Winzar Kakiouea, a 100-meter runner, is the only competitor at the Paris Games from his Pacific island nation. His debut might be over in a flash.

item.title: Instagram blocked by Turkish government over its censorship of eulogies for killed Hamas leader
item.description: Hamas political chief Ismail Haniyeh was known to be a close friend of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

item.title: Harris Campaign Says It Raised $310 Million in July, More Than Double Trump’s Haul
item.description: In the seven days after President Biden stepped down as the presumptive Democratic nominee, the Harris campaign raked in $200 million.

item.title: Famine Declared in Darfur Region of Sudan
item.description: Experts who monitor global hunger rarely make an official declaration of famine, but they just sounded the alarm for more than half a million people who have fled the fighting in Sudan’s civil war.

item.title: Taxi drivers in France demand payout after months of Olympic gridlock in Paris
item.description: Some taxi drivers reported their income had nearly halved over the last seven months.
